intro: Adenocalymma salzmannii, commonly known as the Salzmann's adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
